com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class TimetableSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ViewSettings
      • com.mindfusion.scheduling.TimetableSettings

  • public final class TimetableSettings
extends ViewSettings
    Defines properties that allow customizing the visualization of the calendar in Timetable view.

      Gets the minimum size of the header displaying all-day items.

      Gets a value indicating whether the Timetable view will automatically scroll one day forth and back when the user moves the mouse at the top or at the bottom of the view.

      Gets a value indicating whether the item collision processing is enabled.

      Gets a value indicating whether items longer than 24 hours are displayed in the day header or not.

      Gets a value indicating whether custom snapping is enabled.

      Gets a value indicating whether to color the work-time cells in weekend days.

      Gets the end time of the timetable, expressed in minutes since the beginning of the day.

      Gets whether the active item should ignore collisions.

      Gets the string to use when formatting times in the timeline.

      Gets the number of hours to group when TimetableSettings.getGroupHours() is enabled.
      java.lang.Boolean getGroupHours()
      Gets a value indicating whether hours displayed in the timeline are grouped.

      Gets how to format and display dates in the timetable header.

      Gets the color of the shadows cast by headers.

      Gets the offset of the shadows from the headers that cast them.

      Gets the style of the shadows cast by headers.

      Gets the format of the hours displayed in the timeline.

      Gets the brush used to paint the info header.

      Gets the size of the main header.

      Gets a value indicating whether the header texts are rotated in a view with Horizontal orientation.

      Gets the offset in hours of the second timeline.

      Gets a value indicating whether a second timeline is displayed in addition to the primary one.

      Gets a value indicating whether the whole day is selected when the user clicks in the column's header.

      Gets a value indicating whether the AM and PM suffixes are displayed.

      Gets a value indicating whether to display the current time in the timeline.

      Gets a value indicating whether to show the header displaying all-day items.
      java.lang.Boolean getShowInfoHeader()
      Gets a value indicating whether to show the info header.
      java.lang.Boolean getShowItemSpans()
      Gets a value indicating whether the item time spans are also projected in the left band of the corresponding column.
      java.lang.Boolean getShowMinutesInHourHeaders()
      Gets a value indicating whether to display the minutes of each hour in the timeline header when it displays whole hour cells.
      java.lang.Boolean getShowMoreItemsCue()
      Gets a value indicating whether to display a 'more items' icon in the timeline header when some items in a timetable column are not currently visible.

      Gets a value indicating whether the Timetable view displays navigation buttons.

      Gets a value indicating whether padding should be disabled.

      Gets a value indicating whether the work time should be displayed with different style.

      Gets the custom snap interval.

      • getMainHeaderSize

        public java.lang.Integer getMainHeaderSize()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets the size of the main header.

        A value of 0 causes the calendar to automatically calculate a header size based on the size of the header font.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying the size of the header in pixels.

        Returns:

      • setStartTime

        public void setStartTime(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Sets the start time of the timetable, expressed in minutes since the beginning of the day.
        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying the view start time in minutes. The allowed values range from 0 to 1440. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getEndTime

        public java.lang.Integer getEndTime()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets the end time of the timetable, expressed in minutes since the beginning of the day.

        Specifying value for this property which is smaller than the value of TimetableSettings.getStartTime() is permissible. This indicates that the end value represents time from the next day. For example, if TimetableSettings.getStartTime() is set to 600 (10:00 AM) and TimetableSettings.getEndTime() is set to 480 (8:00 AM), then each column in the view represents the time from 10:00 AM until 8:00 AM on the following day. Specifying 1920 (480 + 1440) for the TimetableSettings.getEndTime() yields the same result.

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying the end time in minutes. The allowed values range from 0 to 2880.

      • setEndTime

        public void setEndTime(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Sets the end time of the timetable, expressed in minutes since the beginning of the day.

        Specifying value for this property which is smaller than the value of TimetableSettings.getStartTime() is permissible. This indicates that the end value represents time from the next day. For example, if TimetableSettings.getStartTime() is set to 600 (10:00 AM) and TimetableSettings.getEndTime() is set to 480 (8:00 AM), then each column in the view represents the time from 10:00 AM until 8:00 AM on the following day. Specifying 1920 (480 + 1440) for the TimetableSettings.getEndTime() yields the same result.

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying the end time in minutes. The allowed values range from 0 to 2880. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getCellTime

        public Duration getCellTime()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets the time length of a single cell in a timetable view, accurate to the nearest second.

        Valid values for this property range from 1 second to 1 hour.

        Returns:
        A Duration object that specifies the time length of a single cell. The allowed values range from 1 second to 1 hour inclusive.

      • setCellTime

        public void setCellTime(Duration value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Sets the time length of a single cell in a timetable view, accurate to the nearest second.

        Valid values for this property range from 1 second to 1 hour.

        Parameters:
        value - A Duration object that specifies the time length of a single cell. The allowed values range from 1 second to 1 hour inclusive. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getWorkTimeStartHour

        public java.lang.Integer getWorkTimeStartHour()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets the start hour of the work time interval.

        This property and TimetableSettings.getWorkTimeEndHour() specify the working time period, whose cells are usually displayed in a different style as set in TimetableSettings.setWorkTimeCellStyle(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Style). To use the same style for all cells in the timetable view, set TimetableSettings.setWorkTimeCellStyle(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Style) to a new empty Style.

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying the start of the work time in hours. The allowed values range from 0 to 23. The value cannot be greater than TimetableSettings.getWorkTimeEndHour().

      • setWorkTimeStartHour

        public void setWorkTimeStartHour(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Sets the start hour of the work time interval.

        This property and TimetableSettings.getWorkTimeEndHour() specify the working time period, whose cells are usually displayed in a different style as set in TimetableSettings.setWorkTimeCellStyle(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Style). To use the same style for all cells in the timetable view, set TimetableSettings.setWorkTimeCellStyle(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Style) to a new empty Style.

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying the start of the work time in hours. The allowed values range from 0 to 23. The value cannot be greater than TimetableSettings.getWorkTimeEndHour(). Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getWorkTimeEndHour

        public java.lang.Integer getWorkTimeEndHour()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets the end hour of the work time interval.

        This property and TimetableSettings.getWorkTimeStartHour() specify the working time period, whose cells are usually displayed in a different style as set in TimetableSettings.setWorkTimeCellStyle(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Style). To use the same style for all cells in the timetable view, set TimetableSettings.setWorkTimeCellStyle(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Style) to a new empty Style.

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying the start of the work time in hours. The allowed values range from 0 to 23. The value cannot be less than TimetableSettings.getWorkTimeStartHour().

      • setWorkTimeEndHour

        public void setWorkTimeEndHour(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings

        This property and TimetableSettings.getWorkTimeStartHour() specify the working time period, whose cells are usually displayed in a different style as set in TimetableSettings.setWorkTimeCellStyle(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Style). To use the same style for all cells in the timetable view, set TimetableSettings.setWorkTimeCellStyle(com.mindfusion.scheduling.model.Style) to a new empty Style.

      • setMinuteFormat

        public void setMinuteFormat(MinuteFormat value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings

      • getMaxAllDayItems

        public java.lang.Integer getMaxAllDayItems()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets the maximum number of all-day items visible in the columns headers at a time.

        The all-day items header is automatically resized to hold all items up to the number set in this property. If there are more all-day items, the rest of them are not shown. In that case, the 'hidden items' icon is displayed if TimetableSettings.getShowMoreItemsCue() is enabled.

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying how many all-day items to display at most in the column headers. The allowed values range from 1 to 20.

      • setMaxAllDayItems

        public void setMaxAllDayItems(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Sets the maximum number of all-day items visible in the columns headers at a time.

        The all-day items header is automatically resized to hold all items up to the number set in this property. If there are more all-day items, the rest of them are not shown. In that case, the 'hidden items' icon is displayed if TimetableSettings.getShowMoreItemsCue() is enabled.

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying how many all-day items to display at most in the column headers. The allowed values range from 1 to 20. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getOrientation

        public Orientation getOrientation()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets the view orientation.

        A vertical timetable view displays cells for the same daytime in a row, and cells for the same date in a column. A horizontal timetable view displays cells for the same time of the day in a column, and cells for the same date in a row.

        Returns:
        One of the Orientation constants.

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(Orientation value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Sets the view orientation.

        A vertical timetable view displays cells for the same daytime in a row, and cells for the same date in a column. A horizontal timetable view displays cells for the same time of the day in a column, and cells for the same date in a row.

        Parameters:
        value - One of the Orientation constants. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

        public java.lang.Boolean getReverseGrouping()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether grouping (if enabled) will be performed first by the resource, and then by the date.

        By default grouping is done first by available dates, then by the resources specified in the current grouping type. Setting this property to true reverses this behavior.

      • getEnableDayItems

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableDayItems()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether items longer than 24 hours are displayed in the day header or not.

        By default, items longer than 1 day or items marked as AllDayEvent are displayed in the day header of the view. If the day header is not displayed (that is, TimetableSettings.getShowDayHeader() is set to false) then these items are never displayed. Settings this property to false causes all items regardless of their length to be displayed in the main view.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setEnableDayItems

        public void setEnableDayItems(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether items longer than 24 hours are displayed in the day header or not.

        By default, items longer than 1 day or items marked as AllDayEvent are displayed in the day header of the view. If the day header is not displayed (that is, TimetableSettings.getShowDayHeader() is set to false) then these items are never displayed. Settings this property to false causes all items regardless of their length to be displayed in the main view.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

        public void setItemOffset(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Sets the distance between the first item and its adjoining cell side.
        Parameters:
        value - A non-negative integer value specifying the item offset in pixels. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getEnableAutoDayChange

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableAutoDayChange()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the Timetable view will automatically scroll one day forth and back when the user moves the mouse at the top or at the bottom of the view.
        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • getEnableCollisions

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableCollisions()
        Description copied from class: TimetableSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the item collision processing is enabled.

        Turn this flag off if you don't need collision detection to improve performance.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setEnableCollisions

        Turn this flag off if you don't need collision detection to improve performance.
